IX.i.3.D.4.c
.
Applicability of the Educational Expense Deduction to Children
The educational expense deduction for children applies
only
in current-law pension cases.
Per
38 CFR 3.272(j)(2)
, the educational expense deduction applies
to cases in which the child is
the payee, and
a dependent on a Veteran’s or surviving spouse’s claim
only
to reduce the child’s earned income and does
not
apply if the child has only unearned income, and
only
if the child is pursuing a course of post-secondary (after high school) education or training.
Note
:  Deductible expenses include amounts paid for tuition, fees, books, and materials.
